alert.note: Alert for Austin; Colorado; Fort Bend; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 30 at 8:28AM CST until January 30 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River Near East Bernard affecting Austin, Colorado, Fort Bend and Wharton Counties. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Sweeny, Boling... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Bernard River Near East Bernard. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins in the vicinity of the gage with minor roads along the river inundated. Backwater flooding up Britt Branch and Bratcher Slough begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CST Monday the stage was 17.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM CST Monday was 17.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 14.0 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.0 feet on 02/22/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu San Bernard River East Bernard 17.0 17.0 Mon 8 am CST 16.8 16.4 15.7 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 600 PM CST.
